intro: Polygala oliveriana, commonly known as the Oliver's milk-vetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, with a distinctive hooded structure that resembles a small helmet. Polygala oliveriana is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
